subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Use of half-letters
msgSnippet: ... The book I used when learning shorthand (20 years ago now...) had exercises for reading, but also stressed that one should not only *read* the reading
messageBody:
On 2007-09-18 Ron Cameron wrote:
> Reading is slower going, of course. It's almost like
> returning to grade school and sounding out words. More
> daily practice will help, I know.

The book I used when learning shorthand (20 years ago
now...) had exercises for reading, but also stressed that
one should not only *read* the reading exercises but
retranscribe them into longhand. I decided to save my own
shorthand notes and then after a while -- a few days to
start with, then progressively longer -- retranscribe them
into longhand when I no longer had their content in fresh
memory. I found that to be an excellent exercise, and I can
tell from experience that it works with QS as well.

: /|
: _| | /BP
: \|
